intro: Bunium cylindricum subsp. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed fennel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The subspecies is distinguished by its longer, more robust stems compared to other forms of Bunium cylindricum.
